Crime_Name: Marriage Fraud under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage was genuine or primarily for acquiring status or privilege
Credibility_Assessment: Panel questioned credibility based on non-cohabitation and timing of disclosure
Legal_Provision: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Basis_of_Claim: Marriage not genuine and entered into for immigration advantage
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Non-cohabitation, timing of refugee claim disclosure
Regulation_Cited: Section 4, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Application_Error: Panel ignored key evidence and drew unreasonable conclusions
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside; remanded for reconsideration by a different panel
Evidence_Ignored: Consistent testimonies, financial support, photos, videos
Application_Factor: Genuineness of marriage, intent at time of marriage
Decision_Outcome: Visa application rejected due to doubts about authenticity of marriage
Decision_Review_Issue: Did the panel err in finding the marriage not genuine?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 4, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Cause_of_Refusal: Doubts about the authenticity of the marriage
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 4, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider relevant evidence, unreasonable inference from gaps
Credibility_Issues: Alleged inconsistencies in cohabitation and disclosure timing
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of the panel's conclusion
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, Section 4
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative tribunal decision
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Marriage not genuine under immigration regulations
